newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Seoul stocks close higher as Hanbo fears ease.
newsitem.headline: Seoul stocks close higher as Hanbo fears ease.

text.p: Stocks closed higher on Friday with broad-based buying as fears ease over the Hanbo Group's financial crisis and ample liquidity, brokers said.
They said the conglomerate's crisis remained as a source of caution but was not adding fresh impact on trading.
The composite index closed at 685.84, up 9.32 points or 1.38 percent. Advancing stocks beat decliners by 592 to 196.
"Liquidity remained high despite the Hanbo scandal due to releases of emergency funds since last week and this boosted buying," said Yoo Nam-gil of Hyundai Securities.
Hanbo Steel, the conglomerate's flagship, is seeking court receivership after piling up almost five trillion won in loans.
The government supplied more than three trillion won into the money market since last week to ease a financial squeeze caused by Hanbo's failure.
Brokers said companies with healthy financial position or those rich with assets were under focus as investors avoided debt-ridden companies due to the Hanbo scandal.
"After the Hanbo crisis, financial position has become the most important consideration for investors," said a Dongwon Securities broker.

Kisan Co rose 800 won to its daily limit of 11,000 on rumours that the company had agreed with a German firm to introduce technology for manufacturing of waste-treatment machinery. A Kisan spokesman refused to comment.
LG Metals Corp went limit-up to 14,900 won by gaining 1,100 won on news that it was negotiating to take a 51-percent stake in a gold mining project in Mali.
The news that the nation's trade deficit for the first 29 days of January was estimated at a record $4.1 billion had little immediate impact on the market, brokers said.
"Trade deficit news had little impact as investors saw impact from the export slump had been reflected on the stock prices," said the Dongwon broker.
Futures March contracts rose 0.15 points to 69.90 while the underlying KOSPI-200 index added 0.81 points to 71.62.
